alert.note: Alert for Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 15 at 1:22AM AKST until February 15 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST TODAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 45 below expected. * WHERE...Near Deering. * WHEN...Until noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills to 45 below could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds are expected to increase tonight near Deering and continue through Wednesday. The strongest winds and coldest wind chills are expected near Deering. Winds are expected to be lower in other locations. Winds are expected to decrease Wednesday afternoon with wind chills becoming less severe then.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
